info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 4 at 2:15PM CDT until July 5 at 4:46AM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...
Guadalupe River At Comfort affecting Kendall County.
Guadalupe River at Hunt affecting Kerr County.
Guadalupe River Near Spring Branch affecting Comal County.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...
Guadalupe River At Kerrville affecting Kerr County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Guadalupe River at Kerrville.
* WHEN...Until late tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Major flooding threatens structures near the river in Kerrville and evacuations are probable below Kerrville.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM CDT Friday the stage was 11.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:45 PM CDT Friday was 23.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will remain near 20 feet before slowly falling below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.9 feet on 11/23/2000. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next issuance will be late tonight by 500 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT
